metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13301 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In FFmpeg 4.0.1, due to a missing check of a profile value before setting it, the ff_mpeg4_decode_picture_header function in libavcodec/mpeg4videodec.c may trigger a NULL pointer dereference while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.2-2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.2-2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.0.2-2
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavformat58 - 7:4.0.2-2
libavutil56 - 7:4.0.2-2
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0.2-2
libswresample3 - 7:4.0.2-2
libswscale5 - 7:4.0.2-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> marking chromium-browser as ignored, since we do full-version updates, and rely on upstream's bundled ffmpeg version

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.2-2').
gst-libav1.0 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mythtv package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
